value: Chuck Norris is a member of the Republican Party and has donated over $32,000 to Republican candidates and organizations since 1988.
He is a supporter of the right to bear arms in the United States.
He opposes the celebration of the Day of Silence in public schools, an event that supports LGBT students and rights.
Since 2006, he has written columns for the conservative website WorldNetDaily, discussing topics such as faith, family, freedom, patriotism, and sometimes kickboxing.
In 2007, he endorsed former Arkansas Governor Mike Huckabee for President of the United States.
After Barack Obama was elected in 2008, Norris wrote a letter urging him to govern from the political center and learn from the mistakes of previous Democratic leaders.
He was one of the first celebrities to publicly support California Proposition 8, which aimed to ban same-sex marriage.

During the 2012 presidential election, he initially supported Ron Paul, then Newt Gingrich. After Gingrich dropped out, he backed Mitt Romney, despite previously criticizing Romney for changing positions and attempting to buy the nomination.
On the eve of the 2012 election, he and his wife Gina released a video warning that if evangelicals didnâ€™t vote or voted for Obama, 'our country as we know it may be lost forever.'
He produced the documentary 'Answering the Call', which highlights his 2007 trip to Iraq to visit American troops.
